The trend's got beauty influencers jumping on too, pairing their snack runs with glossy lips, cute nails, and ""get ready with me for fried pickles"" videos because nothing says main character like matching your aesthetic to your cravings. Because who needs basic sides when pickles got the glow-up?

name: Lace Layering
trend_description: TikTok's fashion and beauty creators are embracing their romantic side with the rising trend of lace layering a dreamy, textured style moment that's all about combining sheer fabrics, vintage charm, and soft silhouettes. From lace camisoles over tees to mesh tops under corsets, creators are showing how to turn delicate into daring with the right layers. Paired with soft glam makeup, rosy cheeks, and barely-there lips, this trend brings a balance of ethereal softness and modern edge. Whether it's giving coquette vibes, Y2K nostalgia, or gothic romance, lace is proving it's not just a fabric it's a full aesthetic. Because when you layer lace, you're layering personality, power, and a touch of poetry.

name: Colorful Home
trend_description: Neutral tones? Not this season. TikTok's home & beauty lovers are trading beige for bold in the 'Color Me Home' trend a vibrant celebration of bright interiors, playful palettes, and unapologetic self-expression. From magenta coffee tables to lime green kitchenware and walls splashed with abstract art, creators are turning their spaces into joy-filled canvases that reflect their personalities. The aesthetic blends dopamine decor with a beauty-first lifestyle where your lipstick matches your throw pillows, and your mood board lives on your living room wall. It's more than just decorating it's curating a space that feels like a daily serotonin boost. Because home should look like you, and in this trend, you're the masterpiece.

name: Paper Plane Spin Challenge
trend_description: This trend is all about turning your love into literal lift-off. Set to M.I.A.'s 'Paper Planes', boyfriends or husbands scoop up their girlfriends and twirl them mid-air like spinning airplanes arms stretched, feet flying, laughter guaranteed. What makes it viral? The combo of chaotic movement + iconic beat + undeniable couple chemistry. It's TikTok's current favorite way to show love, strength, and balance (both emotional and physical!). Whether it's a gym flex or living room silliness, the Paper Plane Spin Challenge is a high-flying celebration of fun-filled romance.

name: Rare Beauty Positive Light Luminizing Lip Gloss
trend_description: TikTok beauty lovers are raving over Rare Beauty's Positive Light Luminizing Lip Gloss a universally flattering gloss that adds glass-like shine, multidimensional shimmer, and weightless hydration without the stick. It's becoming a must-have for natural glam looks and glossy finishing touches alike. Creators are swatching, layering, and zooming in on the gloss's juicy texture, soft shimmer, and lit-from-within payoff all while whispering 'this is not just a gloss it's a glow moment.' It's equal parts subtle and stunning, making it the gloss girlies' new obsession for both no-makeup makeup days and full-glam looks. Whether it's a swipe over bare lips or the final step in a lip combo, this gloss is the main character energy your makeup bag's been waiting for.

name: Popeyes Chicken Dippers
trend_description: FoodTok is getting saucy with the latest drop from Popeyes Chicken Dippers! Bite-sized, golden, and made for dunking, this crispy creation has sparked a flavorful frenzy online. Whether you're testing every dip combo possible or filming the perfect crunch close-up, creators are showing just how addictive these dippers really are. From dramatic first-bite reactions to dip-tier rankings and side-by-side fast food comparisons, the content is as endless as the dipping possibilities. Many videos start with 'I thought I'd just try one' only to end with an empty box and zero regrets. This isn't just a snack it's a scroll-stopping, dip-devouring experience. Small bites, big cravings. Popeyes' Chicken Dippers are the main character of FoodTok right now.

name: Under The Spell: The Bewitching Buzz
trend_description: BookTok is officially spellbound by Silvia Moreno-Garcia's ""The Bewitching"", a gothic-tinged tale of obsession, mystery, and dark magic. This trend celebrates the book's eerie atmosphere and intoxicating plot by featuring haunting visuals, spellbook aesthetics, and reactions filled with gasps and goosebumps. Dark. Hypnotic. Irresistible. 'The Bewitching' is casting its charm over BookTok, one page at a time.

name: Bermuda Shorts
trend_description: TikTok fashion is embracing the breeze with the return of Bermuda shorts, and Gen Z is making them anything but boring. Once reserved for vacation dads and throwback tourists, these longer-line shorts are now a summer staple for style-forward creators. In this trend, fashion TikTokers are styling Bermudas with everything from structured blazers and kitten heels to oversized tees and sneakers proving they're versatile, comfy, and surprisingly chic. Whether it's 'Hot Girl Walks but Make It Bermuda' or 'How I Style Bermudas for 5 Vibes,' the content is all about reinventing a once-dismissed piece into a fashion must-have. From runways to sidewalks, Bermuda shorts are the effortlessly cool comeback no one saw.

name: TSITP Defense Mode: Activated
trend_description: In this hilarious and passionate ""warm-up"" trend, TikTokers are suiting up like they're heading into battle except the battleground is the comment section, and the war? Defending their favorite brother from The Summer I Turned Pretty. With exaggerated stretches, jumpy footwork, and serious fighter energy, creators pair the text ""Warming up to defend the best brother in TSITP"" with intense or dramatic music making it clear they're ready to throw hands (virtually) for either Team Conrad or Team Jeremiah. It's chaotic, it's funny, and it's peak fandom energy because when it comes to summer love triangles, people don't play.

name: Mac Cosmetics Nocturna Collection
trend_description: In the depths of TikTok beauty, creators are diving into MAC Cosmetics' Nocturna Collection, a moody, magnetic lineup that's made for glam after dark. This trend is all about tapping into your mysterious alter ego, with velvet shadows, glossy depths, and sultry tones that feel like midnight bottled into a palette. Whether it's bold lip looks, smoldering eyes, or soft gothic glam, beauty lovers are showcasing full transformations with dramatic transitions, candlelit aesthetics, and captions like 'She only comes out after sunset.' It's elegance with edge and MAC's midnight muse is having a major moment.

name: The Love Hypothesis
trend_description: BookTok is in full meltdown mode as 'The Love Hypothesis' officially heads to the screen and the casting news has everyone talking. Whether you're team 'dream cast or disaster,' this trend captures creators reacting to the announcement with shocked gasps, meme-worthy edits, or side-by-side comparisons of their fan casts versus reality. From dramatic reenactments of Olive and Adam scenes to text overlays like 'This was not on my research hypothesis,' TikTok is turning this adaptation reveal into its own cinematic event. Because if there's one thing BookTok loves more than a slow burn romance... it's debating the casting of it.

name: Queso Crunch Burger
trend_description: FoodTok is biting into bold flavor and celeb flair with Carl's Jr.'s newest obsession: the Queso Crunch Burger. Launching with a sizzling campaign featuring It-girl Alix Earle and an iconic cameo by Paris Hilton, this trend has creators taste-testing the melty, crunchy goodness and giving their unfiltered 'kay so...' reactions. Expect mouthwatering close-ups, chaotic drive-thru runs, and POVs like 'when you try the burger TikTok won't shut up about.' Whether you're here for the queso or the celebrity chaos, this trend is equal parts crunchy, cheesy, and totally binge-worthy.

name: Fringe Frenzy
trend_description: The fashion crowd is shaking things up literally with the rising fringe fashion takeover. From swishy skirts to statement jackets and tassel-trimmed bags, creators are showing how every step becomes a runway when you're dressed in movement. This trend is all about the drama in the details, with content ranging from slow-mo twirls to 'how I styled fringe without looking like a cowboy' transformations. Whether it's vintage-inspired glam or festival-ready flair, TikTok is currently hanging on every thread.

name: Bubble Trend
trend_description: Calling all anime fans and bubble masters this trend fuses Naruto energy with summer magic. Creators start by channeling their inner ninja, forming the iconic Rasengan pose with intense hand motions. But just when you think they're about to unleash chakra, the beat drops... and out comes a perfectly timed bubble burst. It's the ultimate crossover between childhood nostalgia and TikTok creativity, turning backyards and parks into anime training grounds with a bubbly twist.

name: Gloss Bomb Stackz
trend_description: Fenty Beauty just turned gloss into a multi-layered masterpiece with the Gloss Bomb Stackz, and TikTok's beauty scene is obsessed. This limited-edition gloss comes packaged in a sleek stacked tube, holding three clear, super-glossy layers that offer glass-like shine, shimmer, and hydration no lipstick required.

name: Sips & Steals at Applebee's
trend_description: FoodTok is buzzing with crave-worthy combos as Applebee's refreshes its iconic 2 for $25 deal, now featuring hearty new stars like the Chicken Parmesan Fettuccine and the BIG Bangin' Burger. Paired perfectly with their limited-edition Summertime Sips especially the ultra-refreshing Perfect Watermelon Margarita this trend has creators diving into affordable indulgence and giving bite-by-sip reviews. It's a full-course content moment where date nights, bestie dinners, and solo treat-yourself meals take center stage.

name: Watch your back
trend_description: BookTok is on edge thanks to 'Watch Your Back' by Tate James, a suspenseful page-turner that's gripping creators with its sharp twists, slow-burn tension, and characters who might not be who they seem. This trend is all about dramatic reactions, coded annotations, and 'trust no one' edits as readers dive into a story where betrayal lurks on every page. Whether you're screaming at the red flags or romanticizing the morally grey leads, TikTokers are warning one thing loud and clear: read it but watch your back.

name: Hunter Boots
trend_description: Fashion creators are stepping into puddle season with style as Hunter Boots make a bold comeback on TikTok. No longer just a rainy day essential, these iconic boots are being styled with everything from oversized blazers to summer dresses, proving that practical can be chic. Whether you're strutting city sidewalks or dancing in the drizzle, this trend is all about turning wet weather into a runway moment.

name: Fall Garlands
trend_description: Cozy season is creeping in, and TikTok's homebodies are embracing it one leaf at a time. The latest obsession? Fall garlands from fireplace mantels to stair railings, creators are weaving warm-toned leaves, mini pumpkins, fairy lights, and rustic textures into every corner of their home. It's not just dcor it's a mood. This trend celebrates the art of transitioning your space into an autumnal haven that smells like cinnamon and looks like a Pinterest board come to life.

name: Nicki Minaj Pose
trend_description: Confidence meets chaos in this viral challenge inspired by Nicki Minaj's signature pose a high-heel squat with attitude. But TikTok takes it up a notch: girls are now attempting the stunt while balancing on dumbbells, striking fierce poses as if it's nothing. The trend blends fashion, strength, and pure internet audacity, turning gym gear into a runway and proving once and for all Barbz don't buckle.

name: Deep End
trend_description: BookTok is collectively holding its breath as readers plunge into The Deep End by Ali Hazelwood where tension, wit, and irresistible chemistry collide beneath the surface. This trend captures readers' reactions to steamy pages, swoon-worthy banter, and emotional gut-punches, often paired with water-themed aesthetics or dramatic text overlays like 'I wasn't ready for chapter 17.' Whether you're clutching your chest or re-reading your favorite line for the 20th time, this trend is for everyone who loves their romance smart, spicy, and submerged in feels.

name: Nyx Cosmetics Smushy Matte Lip Balm
trend_description: Glide into TikTok's latest beauty obsession with the NYX Smushy Matte Lip Balm a buttery-soft balm-meets-matte hybrid that's taking over GRWM videos and swipe tests everywhere. Creators are raving about its juicy pigment, plush texture, and how it gives 'effortless pout with zero crust.' Whether you're smushing it on in the car or showing off your favorite shade under golden hour lighting, this trend is all about soft glam energy with maximum comfort.

name: Kith x New Balance 204L
trend_description: The fashion world is lacing up for the ultimate streetwear flex with the latest drop: the KITH x New Balance 204L collab. TikTok is buzzing with creators unboxing, styling, and stomping through city streets in the ultra-clean, retro-inspired sneakers. With KITH's refined aesthetic meeting New Balance's timeless comfort, this trend isn't just about footwear it's about walking proof that quiet luxury and street style can run side by side.

name: Sweet Chipotle BBQ Sauce
trend_description: FoodTok is currently obsessed with Taco Bell's new Sweet Chipotle BBQ Sauce a smoky, sweet, and slightly spicy game-changer that's got everyone dipping, drizzling, and remixing their go-to orders. From saucy fry dips to smothered burritos, creators are turning up the heat and showing how this bold new flavor levels up every bite. It's not just a sauce it's the star of the snack show.

name: Sacheu Beauty Launches
trend_description: Sacheu Beauty, creators of the viral peel-off lipliner, has launched 2 new long-lasting products, Eyeshadow Stay-N and Liquid Glow Stay in. Creators and users love the long-wear ability of these products and how they can be worn at the pool, beach, and other summer activities.

name: Fall Decor
trend_description: Autumn has officially entered the chat and creators are turning their homes into cozy, pumpkin-spiced dreams. From plaid throws and cinnamon-scented candles to leafy garlands and miniature gourds, this trend captures the charm of seasonal nesting. With every clip that starts with 'Decorate with me for fall,' TikTok becomes a harvest-inspired haven where burnt oranges, deep reds, and golden tones take center stage. It's not just a vibe it's a full-blown fall aesthetic era.

name: One-Hand Wonder: The Bridal Scoop Challenge
trend_description: Love just got a lift literally. This trend has couples across TikTok showing off strength, trust, and a whole lot of playful romance. With one smooth motion, boyfriends are scooping up their girlfriends one-handed and transitioning effortlessly into a bridal carry. Set to dramatic or cheeky audio, the challenge mixes flirtation with feats of strength, leaving viewers swooning (or laughing) at every lift, stumble, or surprise spin. It's couple-core with a gym-flex twist.

name: Glow & Go: The Kojic Turmeric Toner Wave
trend_description: Beauty and skincare TikTok is buzzing with the Medicube Kojic Acid Turmeric Resurfacing Toner. This glow booster merges potent kojic acid a top brightening agent that tackles dark spots and hyperpigmentation with calming, antioxidant-rich turmeric extract for daily radiance and clarity

name: Out of the Woods
trend_description: BookTok has found its newest obsession in Out of the Woods by Hannah Bonam' Young, a heartfelt contemporary romance that explores identity, grief, and the complexities of love when you've been together since high school. The story centers on Sarah and Caleb Linwood, high school sweethearts married for seventeen years. When Sarah attempts to prove her independence by organizing a fundraiser in memory of her late mother, Caleb swoops in to save the day reigniting old doubts and buried resentments. To mend their relationship, they embark on a week-long wilderness retreat called Reignite, where adventure, DIY therapy, and nature force them to confront what they've lost and what they could still build together.

name: Arizona Whipped Pineapple Orange
trend_description: FoodTok is swirling into a citrusy frenzy with the release of Arizona's new Whipped Pineapple Orange flavor a creamy, dreamy twist on your classic fruit juice. With its tropical tang and whipped texture, this limited-edition drink has creators running to gas stations and corner stores to get their hands on the now-viral can.

name: Baker Boy Hat
trend_description: Fashion TikTok is tipping its hat literally to the rising popularity of baker boy hats, the chic accessory that's making every outfit look instantly editorial. Once a vintage staple, these structured caps are back on the scene and getting a modern twist, styled with everything from oversized blazers to casual denim.

name: HomeGoods Halloween
trend_description: Spooky season has officially crept into HomeTok with HomeGoods' Halloween Special Releases turning everyday creators into full-blown decor witches and warlocks. From ghost-shaped mugs to gothic candle holders, users are posting their Halloween hauls like they've just raided a haunted treasure chest. Expect to see: - Trolley tours with captions like 'I blacked out at HomeGoods and this is what I came home with.' - Aesthetic flatlays of pumpkin pillows, skeleton dishware, and bat garlands. - Cozy montages of creators transforming their space into spooky sanctuaries. - FYPs flooded with the sound of crinkle paper and cauldron-shaped bowls clinking. This trend isn't just about shopping it's about summoning the Halloween spirit early and turning your home into the ultimate haunted hideaway. Let the haunting (and hauling) begin.

name: Throwing a fit trend
trend_description: In this trend, 'throwing a fit' takes on a fashion-first meaning. It starts with a playful POV boyfriends or friend groups saying, 'Sorry we're late, [she/they] were throwing a fit' Then BAM the camera flips to reveal the real reason for the delay: a jaw-dropping outfit reveal. TikTok creators are using this trend to spotlight how a little extra time getting ready is always worth it when you're about to serve a look that slaps harder than the excuse. Whether it's a bestie crew strutting into dinner or a girlfriend stepping out in full glam, 'throwing a fit' has never looked this good. Style + Sass = Late for a reason.

name: Arcana Academy
trend_description: BookTok is spellbound by Arcana Academy by Elise Kova, a dark romantic fantasy that combines tarot-powered magic, royal intrigue, and forbidden alliances. The story follows Clara Graysword, a skilled petty thief caught crafting illegal tarot cards, who is unexpectedly plucked from prison by Prince Kaelis. He offers her freedom but only if she assumes the role of his bride and enters the titular academy under false pretenses.

name: Byoma Blemish
trend_description: Skincare TikTok is misting its way to clarity with the buzz around Byoma's Blemish Relief Soothing Mist Facial Toner. Creators are featuring their daily routines, gently spritzing the toner post-cleanse or midday, visibly reducing redness and calming breakouts. With its alcohol- and fragrance-free formula, this toner doubles as a barrier-strengthening hydration boost perfect for prepping skin before serums or midday skin-saving refreshes.

name: Chips Ahoy Stranger Things
trend_description: FoodTok is flipping out over the limited-edition Chips Ahoy! x Stranger Things collab a nostalgic, eerie, and sweet crossover that takes your taste buds straight into the Upside Down. Whether it's the packaging inspired by Hawkins' most haunted aesthetics or the cookies themselves infused with a dark twist (think fudge-drizzled or Demogorgon-sprinkled delights), creators are taking this launch and running with it. From POV unboxings with flickering lights, to cookie review mukbangs in full '80s fits, the trend thrives on blending eerie vibes with classic comfort food. TikTokers are even staging Stranger Things-style disappearances only to reappear snacking on these collab cookies like it's a post-Demogorgon reward. If you've ever wanted your midnight snack to feel like a Netflix binge turned IRL, this trend brings the bingeable and the edible together. So grab your walkie-talkie, channel your inner Eleven, and head to the Snackside Down.

name: Belt Bags
trend_description: Fashion TikTok is strapping in literally as belt bags make their bold return from practical accessory to certified hot girl essential. Once dubbed the 'tourist pouch,' this hands-free fashion piece is now getting a runway-worthy revival, seen slung across the chest, cinched at the waist, or layered over oversized blazers for that cool-girl streetwear finish. Creators are hopping on the trend by styling belt bags with everything from yoga sets to tailored coats, proving they're not just for hiking trails and music festivals anymore. The best part? It's where form meets function, offering enough room for lip gloss, a card holder, and your entire vibe. Whether you call it a fanny pack, waist bag, or crossbody clutch, one thing's for sure: belt bags are back and chicer than ever.

name: Barely Legal Bars
trend_description: PopTok is spiraling over the unreleased Frank Ocean track ""Trouble"", and one controversial line has taken center stage: 'but barely legal is still legal.' TikTokers are lip-syncing to this provocative snippet with a mix of side-eyes, smirks, and cinematic slow-mo zooms creating the perfect storm of humor, thirst traps, and unspoken judgment. Whether it's a sly take on morally gray crushes, spicy edits, or 'POV: your friend when she hears that line,' creators are using the track to stir the pot and stir the feed. It's chaotic, it's a little wrong, and it's so Frank Ocean-coded. The song may not be out yet, but TikTok is already in Trouble.

name: Grand Millennial Decor
trend_description: HomeTok is falling head-over-heels for Grandmillennial dcor a style that's equal parts nostalgic and sophisticated, bringing vintage elegance back into the modern home. Think floral wallpaper, pleated lampshades, lace-trimmed linens, and needlepoint pillows, all arranged with a curated, maximalist eye. This trend is a cozy rebellion against minimalism, as creators embrace the charm of what once lived in grandma's living room but reimagined through a Pinterest-worthy lens. Layered textures, antique finds, pastel color palettes, and dainty details make every corner feel like a sweet memory, reawakened. It's not just dcor it's a romantic lifestyle aesthetic, and TikTok is absolutely eating it up one chintz curtain at a time.

name: Cheetos Flamin Hot Fiery Skulls
trend_description: FoodTok just hit a spooky new level with the Cheetos' thrilling Flamin' Hot Fiery Skulls collab, featuring Thing from Netflix's Wednesday as its mischievous new spokeshand. In this wildly popular TikTok trend, creators unwrap the neon-red skull-shaped chips, filth their fingers with orange "cheetle," and watch Thing slam his royal fingertip into billboards, taxis, and city streets in a bold Times Square takeover.

name: Elf Cosmetics Jelly Pop Collection
trend_description: TikTok's beauty scene just got juicier the beloved e.l.f. Jelly Pop Collection is officially making its sweet, sticky comeback, and beauty creators can't stop gushing. Known for its watermelon scent, bouncy textures, and juicy glow, the Jelly Pop line is popping back into vanities and GRWM routines with a nostalgic vengeance. From dewy skin preps to glossed-up lips and cheeks, this trend is all about showing off your jelly-skinned look while unboxing the vibrant collection or layering it on in ASMR-worthy makeup montages. It's fruity, it's fun, and it's giving major Y2K-glow nostalgia. The verdict? Summer just got its main character back and she smells like watermelon.

name: The Ever Seas Special Edition
trend_description: BookTok is making waves again this time with the special edition of The Ever Seas stealing the spotlight. With its shimmery sprayed edges, exclusive cover art, and bonus content tucked between the pages, this collector's dream is more than just a rerelease it's a full-on oceanic obsession. Readers are posting dramatic unboxings, bookshelf reveals, and cozy reading vlogs, all soundtracked by sea-inspired music or stormy ambience. It's not just about reading the book it's about experiencing it like a treasure pulled from the deep. Whether you're a returning fan or new to the world of The Ever Seas, this trend is a tidal surge of aesthetic content, fan theories, and pure fantasy escapism with a touch of saltwater magic.

name: Drop Waist Dress
trend_description: Fashion TikTok is falling head over heels for the silhouette that says chic without trying the drop waist dress. From vintage-inspired romance to minimalist cool-girl energy, this trend takes the waistline and lowers it along with all fashion expectations. With flowy hems, subtle drama, and a nod to 1920s flapper flair, creators are styling drop waists with ballet flats, cowboy boots, and slicked-back buns, serving major effortless it-girl vibes. Whether it's linen for summer strolls or structured for streetwear statements, the drop waist is proving that you don't need a cinch to make a statement. The best part? It's giving comfort and couture. This is the dress that says: 'I don't need a corset I've got confidence.

name: Face Score
trend_description: Pop culture meets playful competition in the viral ""Who Gets the Better Face Score?"" trend where friends, couples, or siblings go head-to-head in front of the now-famous face-scoring filter. With a quick scan and dramatic reveal, the filter assigns a numerical beauty score, sparking reactions that range from smug grins to exaggerated betrayal. Creators are leaning into the chaos, using humor, confidence, or irony to react to their scores some even challenging the algorithm with 'rematch' videos. Whether it's all in good fun or a lighthearted flex, one thing's for sure: the filter judges, but TikTok claps back.

name: Warm Earthy Interior
trend_description: HomeTok is embracing the calm of the natural world with the rise of warm earthy interior design a cozy, grounded aesthetic built on terracotta tones, clay neutrals, rich browns, soft taupes, and sun-washed beiges. Think rustic textures, linen curtains, wooden accents, and ceramic touches that make your space feel like a serene retreat in the heart of the desert or a slow-living cottage dream. Creators are sharing room makeovers, thrift finds, and color palette guides to achieve this aesthetic that feels both timeless and modern. Whether it's a burnt sienna accent wall or a sandstone-hued couch, this trend is all about inviting warmth, grounding energy, and organic flow into your home. Because your space should exhale with you.

name: Chasing Shelter
trend_description: BookTok is falling hard for Chasing Shelter by Catherine Cowles, the emotional new installment (Book #5) of the Sparrow Falls series. When Ellie Pierce moves to the quiet town of Sparrow Falls to escape her father's criminal life, she instantly finds herself caught in the orbit of Trace Colson her protective, brooding neighbor who also happens to be her brother's best friend. What begins as a reluctant arrangement turns into a slow-burn romance: Trace becomes Ellie's shield against an encroaching danger, and together they navigate grief, found family, and healing under pressure. With living-room firefights, intense protective instincts, and small-town suspense, this book balances kiss-worthy romance with real emotional stakes.

name: Toasty Makeup
trend_description: Say goodbye to cool-toned glam the 'Toasty Makeup' trend is heating up beauty TikTok with bronzed lids, cinnamon-kissed blush, and honey-glazed lips. Inspired by warm coffee tones and golden-hour light, this look is all about creating a soft, sun-drenched effect that flatters every skin tone. Creators are layering terracotta eyeshadows, warm contour sticks, and golden highlighters to achieve that ""fresh off a vacation"" finish. Think bronzer-heavy, blush-forward, and softly sculpted like your face just took a dip in a mug of warm chai. It's cozy, radiant, and effortlessly sunkissed.

name: Camo Outfits
trend_description: Fashionistas are reporting for style duty because camo is no longer just for combat, it's couture. The iconic military print has reemerged on FashionTok, not as a background pattern, but as the main character. From oversized camo cargos paired with crop tops to structured camo jackets thrown over slinky dresses, creators are remixing this utilitarian staple with high-fashion flair. TikTok is packed with transformation edits showing ""basic to baddie"" looks using camo pants, vintage military jackets, or camo-coordinated sets. Whether it's giving early 2000s Destiny's Child vibes or streetwear edge, the camo trend is all about balancing gritty and glam think combat boots + glossy lips, or army green + gold hoops. Some even caption their fits with ""blend in? never heard of her"" because ironically, the goal now is to stand out.

name: Spongebob Olipop Pineapple Paradise
trend_description: FoodTok is fizzing with nostalgia and vibes thanks to the limited-edition "Pineapple Paradise" Olipop, created in collab with Netflix's SpongeBob SquarePants. Released to hype The SpongeBob Movie: Search for SquarePants, this prebiotic soda drops fans into a fizzy tropical escape powered by pineapple, mandarin, and classic soda feel all while promoting gut health with plant fiber and botanical.

name: Cozy Corners
trend_description: Forget full house tours TikTok's newest obsession is all about the cozy corners. In this home lifestyle trend, creators are zooming in on the nooks, crannies, and sunlit spots that spark peace, creativity, or comfort. Think reading chairs surrounded by plants, window-side coffee tables with flickering candles, or a tiny corner shelf glowing with fairy lights and memories. These videos often carry soothing background music or ambient soundscapes, paired with captions like ""my favorite spot at home"" or ""where I recharge."" It's a soft, intimate look at how people carve out little sanctuaries in their space, whether in a bustling apartment or a quiet cottagecore haven. More than just decor inspo, this trend taps into the growing love for intentional living, where even one square meter can feel like a hug.

name: Mask and Maki Moment by Hailey Bieber
trend_description: Hailey Bieber has done it again setting the internet ablaze with a moment so casual, it's iconic. In the now-trending clip, she's seen casually munching on sushi while wearing a full-face skincare mask, and just like that, a new beauty-lifestyle crossover was born. TikTok users are jumping on the ""Mask & Maki Moment"" trend by recreating the effortlessly cool vibe: sheet mask on, chopsticks out, and camera rolling. It's self-care meets sushi date a vibe that's equal parts glam and chill. The aesthetic? Glowy skin, glossy lips, minimalist lighting, and, of course, a spicy tuna roll. The trend isn't just about copying Hailey it's about embracing luxury in the little moments and making skincare feel stylishly indulgent.

name: S-Lines
trend_description: Straight out of the K-drama universe and into TikTok feeds comes S-Line Stats a viral pop culture trend where users try out the new filter that ""counts"" how many S-lines (a slang term for body count in the context of the trending K-drama) someone supposedly has. The trend exploded following buzz around a new K-drama where characters casually drop references to S-lines, leaving viewers both intrigued and amused. Now, TikTokers are joining the fun by using the filter and reacting to their scores some dramatically clutching their pearls at a high number, others laughing at a suspiciously low one. The tone is cheeky, light-hearted, and playfully chaotic. Some even rope in friends or partners to do a ""S-line reveal"" side by side, turning the filter into a meme generator and pop culture talking point.

name: Black & White Stripes
trend_description: Black and white stripes are making a sharp return on FashionTok, and this time it's not just about classic Parisian chic it's bold, graphic, and stealing the spotlight. From oversized button-downs to tailored trousers, maxi skirts, and structured blazers, creators are embracing black-and-white striped pieces to build high-contrast, eye-catching looks. The aesthetic balances timeless sophistication with runway drama, giving off everything from Beetlejuice-core to modern-day mod. TikToks show creators styling vertical stripes for elongation, mixing widths for visual intrigue, or going head-to-toe stripe for full monochrome power. Paired with chunky accessories or minimal makeup, the look is polished yet playful perfect for OOTD reveals, styling challenges, and fall fashion hauls.

name: Spicy Tuna Crispy Rice Hack
trend_description: FoodTok has officially hacked sushi night and it's giving 5-star vibes on a budget. The Crispy Crunch Sushi Hack is taking over feeds as creators transform basic grocery store sushi into restaurant-style spicy tuna crispy rice right at home. The formula? Grab a cheap tuna roll, deconstruct it, mash the tuna with spicy mayo, fry up the rice into golden crispy bites, and stack it back together. What you get is that coveted crispy-on-the-outside, creamy-on-the-inside texture minus the sushi chef or the high-end tab. TikTok users are adding their own twists with jalapeos, avocado, or drizzled sauces, making it both a glow-up and a creative challenge. It's affordable, satisfying, and seriously snack-worthy.

name: Raspberry Syrup is back in Starbucks
trend_description: Starbucks fans are stirring up excitement as the beloved Raspberry Syrup makes its long-awaited comeback and FoodTok is already drowning in pastel-pink drink creations and nostalgic sips. From secret menu refreshers to ultra-aesthetic iced matcha and vanilla lattes with a berry twist, creators are sharing their best raspberry remix hacks whether it's reordering their old favorites or inventing new combos like raspberry cold foam or syrup-swapped pink drinks.

name: August TBR
trend_description: As a new month begins, BookTok dives headfirst into the August TBR (To-Be-Read) wave, where readers curate and showcase their handpicked lineup of books for the month. From spicy romances and dark academia thrillers to cozy beach reads, creators are stacking their shelves and timelines with aesthetic flatlays, moodboards, and dramatic reading plans. Each post feels like a personal diary entry, with captions like 'manifesting reading all of these' or 'this month's lineup is pure serotonin.' Some even sort by vibes rainy day reads, weekend coffee shop picks, or books that 'just feel like Leo season.' This trend fuels excitement, inspires book swaps, and helps the community discover new titles because let's be real, half the fun of reading is planning what to read next.

name: Living at home in your 20s
trend_description: Home isn't just a place it's a whole era. On HomeTok, creators in their 20s are redefining what it means to live with your parents, turning what was once a taboo into a comforting, empowering lifestyle. Whether it's decorating childhood bedrooms into dreamy grown-up sanctuaries, cooking meals with mom, or romanticizing slow mornings in their family homes, this trend leans into cozy content with real-life relatability. TikToks often carry text overlays like 'me romanticizing my 20s while still living at home' or 'normalize staying home to save up and heal your inner child,' paired with clips of candlelit corners, shared dinners, or self-care routines in their teenage bathroom. It's a mix of nostalgia, practicality, and self-love proving that growth doesn't have to mean moving out, and thriving can happen right under your childhood roof.

name: Dancing in Glow Sticks
trend_description: Pop culture and party vibes collide in 'Glow Mode Activated,' the latest viral dance trend lighting up TikTok literally. Set to the high-energy beat of this glowing audio, creators turn off the lights, suit up in glow-in-the-dark sticks, and transform their living rooms into DIY dance raves. The magic? It's not just the choreography it's the silhouettes pulsing in neon as bodies move to the music in a blackout. From full stick-figure suits to minimal accent lighting on wrists and ankles, this trend turns everyone into their own human LED light show. Whether you're solo dancing or glowing up as a group, this trend is pure visual serotonin and late-night fun wrapped in TikTok brilliance.

name: Medicube PDRN Pink Peptide Serum
trend_description: Skincare lovers on TikTok are currently obsessed with Medikube's PDRN Pink Peptide Serum, and the trend is taking over #SkinTok with glowing results. Dubbed the 'Pink Potion Fix,' this luxurious, blush-toned serum is being hailed as a skin revival elixir thanks to its powerhouse combo of PDRN (polydeoxyribonucleotide) and peptides ingredients known for intense repair, plumping, and skin barrier strengthening. Creators are showcasing their before-and-after glow-ups, daily application routines, and those oddly satisfying serum drop shots all while highlighting how this K-beauty gem revives tired, dull skin into a smoother, bouncier, and more luminous version of itself. With its elegant glass dropper, soothing glide, and rosy aesthetic, this serum is becoming the newest shelfie star and a must-have in beauty rituals aiming for that ""lit-from-within"" radiance.

name: Chicken Caesar Smashed Tacos
trend_description: FoodTok has found its latest obsession, and it's a mouthwatering mashup no one saw coming: Chicken Caesar Smashed Tacos. Think crispy taco shells, smashed with juicy grilled chicken, smothered in creamy Caesar dressing, topped with romaine, parmesan, and a flavorful crunch that's breaking the internet one bite at a time. Creators are calling it the salad wrap's cooler, hotter cousin and watching the satisfying smash + sizzle of tortillas on the griddle is half the fun. From quick lunch hacks to elevated dinner ideas, this trend is turning Caesar salad into a full-blown handheld experience. It's crunchy, creamy, and totally viral.

name: Wrath of the Dragons
trend_description: BookTok is ablaze with fire and fury as readers dive into the newly released fantasy epic Wrath of the Dragons and the hype is real. Tagged under #WrathWatchBegins, creators are filming their unboxings, aesthetic moodboards, and page-flipping reactions to this high-stakes, dragon-fueled saga. The book is packed with ancient prophecies, royal betrayal, mythical beasts, and a heroine who's more flame than flower, making it the perfect binge for lovers of high fantasy with a dark twist. With every fiery plot twist and emotionally-charged chapter, TikTok is full of gasps, fan art, and theories especially about that dragon bond moment everyone's losing it over. This isn't just a read it's a full-on fandom ignition. Spoiler alert: TikTok is not emotionally prepared for what the wrath brings.

name: Mesh Ballet Flats
trend_description: TikTok's fashion crowd is pirouetting into their latest obsession: mesh ballet flats. A breezy blend of elegance and edge, these see-through shoes are redefining the balletcore aesthetic think delicate tulle-like texture, airy silhouettes, and just enough skin to tease. Whether paired with cargos, denim maxis, or flowy dresses, creators are flaunting how this dainty-yet-daring footwear instantly elevates an outfit. Soft, sculptural, and effortlessly chic, mesh ballet flats are twirling their way into everyone's closet as the statement shoe of the moment. From barre to brunch it's a fashion leap worth taking.

name: Jaffa Cake McFlurry
trend_description: McDonald's has just dropped a dessert remix that has TikTok tastebuds spinning the Jaffa Cake McFlurry. A zesty-meets-chocolatey twist, this limited-time treat swirls velvety soft-serve with chunks of iconic Jaffa Cakes and a ripple of tangy orange sauce. Foodies on TikTok are racing to their nearest Golden Arches to try the nostalgic flavor fusion, filming first bites, taste tests, and dramatic spoon dives. Whether you're in it for the citrus kick or the rich chocolate swirl, this mashup is stirring major buzz as the coolest way to beat the heat (and feed your inner child). Citrus, swirl, serve. Repeat.

name: Roar of the England Lionesses
trend_description: SportTok is all about this real-life epic: the England Lionesses' dramatic victory at UEFA Women's Euro 2025. It all came to a head in the final in Basel, where they went head-to-head with reigning champions Spain. Despite conceding first to a Mariona Caldentey header, Alessia Russo equalized and forced extra time. In a nerve-wracking penalty shootout, goalkeeper Hannah Hampton saved two penalties and Chloe Kelly slotted the winner, securing a 3-1 victory on penalties after a 1-1 draw through regulation and extra time. England retained their title and made history becoming the first senior England team to win a major tournament on foreign soil.

name: Reposts vs Reality
trend_description: In this viral pop culture trend, creators are serving up side-by-side emoji storytelling that hits hilariously close to home. The format? Simple but genius. Users share clips of their friends or significant others, first showing their 'Reposts' the way they curate themselves online, using a series of cool, moody, or aesthetic emojis like then flip the camera to real life with a new emoji lineup that's pure chaos or softness think or . It's a clever and comedic way of highlighting the contrast between internet personas vs actual personalities all while keeping it affectionate and relatable. Whether it's your bestie who posts like a mysterious villain but lives like a cartoon sidekick, or your partner whose online vibe screams but IRL they're giving this trend shows that what's real is what we really love.

name: 5 Book Challenge
trend_description: Booktok is turning into a literary battleground with the rise of the 'Top 5 Book Challenge' a trend where readers confidently (and sometimes controversially) share their all-time top 5 books, ranked or unranked, by vibes alone. Whether it's a mix of heartbreaking romances, unhinged morally gray characters, cozy fantasies, or plot-twist thrillers, creators are revealing the titles that wrecked them, healed them, or turned them into readers in the first place. Expect spicy takes, passionate defenses, and a lot of 'don't come for me' disclaimers in the captions. Bonus points if the list is delivered with aesthetic overlays, dramatic piano music, or emotional damage edits.

name: VT PDRN Capsule Cream
trend_description: BeautyTok is buzzing over the latest K-beauty innovation the VT PDRN Capsule Cream a luxe new skincare release from VT Cosmetics that's turning futuristic skincare into a daily ritual. With its unique capsule formula, this cream delivers a powerful dose of PDRN (polydeoxyribonucleotide), known for its skin-repairing and regenerative properties, straight into your skin with every use. What's got creators hooked? The bursting capsules melt into a silky, skin-loving cream that boosts hydration, improves elasticity, and visibly revives tired, stressed skin making it feel like a spa day in a jar. The trend features up-close ASMR of capsules popping, dreamy before-and-after skin glows, and that satisfying 'tap-tap-absorb' moment. If you're into skincare that feels science-backed, sensorial, and straight-up bougie, this one's your next obsession.

name: Heytea Dubai Chocolate Drink
trend_description: FoodTok has a new obsession, and it's flown straight from Dubai to the streets of New York the viral Heytea Dubai Chocolate drink. Known for its ultra-rich, velvety texture and decadent layers of deep cocoa goodness, this luxurious drink has become the must-try treat for sweet-toothed adventurers and aesthetic caf hoppers alike. In this trend, creators are lining up at Heytea NYC, filming the stunning pour, the dramatic first sip, and of course, the iconic swirl of chocolate that's got everyone saying: 'This isn't just a drink it's an experience.' Whether it's the over-the-top reactions or the cinematic B-roll of chocolate drizzle, this trend is fueling a serious case of drink envy across TikTok.

name: New Balance 9060
trend_description: FashionTok is lacing up with excitement as creators unbox the highly coveted New Balance 9060 a silhouette that fuses retro running aesthetics with futuristic design. With its chunky sole, wavy lines, and perfect balance between sporty and street, the NB 9060 is quickly becoming a favorite for sneakerheads and fashion minimalists alike. The trend features aesthetic unboxing videos, satisfying peel-off moments, close-ups of suede and mesh details, and, of course, outfit pairings that prove this sneaker goes with everything. Whether you're team neutral tones or bold colorways, the 9060 is stepping into the spotlight and TikTok is here for it.

name: Correa's Curve: The Goal Heard Around SportsTok
trend_description: SportsTok is lighting up after ngel Correa delivered that goal an electrifying strike that's got everyone, from die-hard fans to casual scrollers, pressing replay. Whether you caught it live or saw the highlight explode across your FYP, Correa's move is being hailed as one of the most jaw-dropping goals of the season. Set against a high-stakes moment, the Atltico Madrid forward showcased pure finesse and precision, weaving through defenders before launching a curved shot that tucked perfectly into the back of the net. It's the kind of goal that makes even rivals nod in respect.

name: McDonalds Summer Menu
trend_description: FastFoodTok is heating up with the arrival of McDonald's Summer Menu 2025, and creators are taste-testing their way through every sun-soaked bite. From limited-edition burgers with bold, smoky twists to fruity, ice-cold drinks that scream summer vacation in a cup, this menu is bringing the vibes straight to your tray. Whether it's the sweet-meets-savory flavor combos, the refreshing seasonal sundaes, or those juicy, TikTok-famous bites caught in slow-mo, the Golden Arches are serving more than just food they're dishing out full-on summer content. Creators are rating, ranking, and reacting in real time and viewers are lining up for a bite of the trend.

name: Amazon Fall Finds
trend_description: HomeTok is officially in fall mode, and creators are flocking to TikTok to share their favorite Amazon fall finds the cozy, the chic, and the pumpkin-spiced essentials you never knew you needed. From soft plaid throws and warm-toned glassware to faux leaf garlands and pumpkin-shaped candles, these viral Amazon hauls are transforming everyday spaces into autumnal dreamscapes. Think 'Gilmore Girls' vibes meets budget-friendly elegance.

name: This and No One's Son
trend_description: In a world where dating drama often takes center stage, TikTok girls are flipping the narrative with a trend that screams freedom, self-love, and unbothered vibes. This viral sound features creators sharing dreamy, soft-glow snippets of their lives sunset drives, solo coffee runs, spa days, bookshop strolls, or cozy nights in paired with the now-iconic text overlay: 'This and no one's son bothering you.' It's not anti-love it's pro-peace. The trend celebrates the calm and clarity that comes from living life on your own terms, without the chaos of complicated texts or mixed signals. Think of it as a visual sigh of relief wrapped in aesthetic clips and quiet luxury energy. Whether it's healing, thriving, or just vibing, TikTok is showing that sometimes the softest love story is the one you live with yourself.

name: Magician Era
trend_description: Welcome to the Magician Era, where TikTok girls are casting spells literally and figuratively. This whimsical trend has creators performing a simple sleight of hand: ripping a piece of paper or snapping their fingers with a flick of flair. Then, poof! like magic a flirty text appears saying things like: 'I only like girls who do magic' or 'He said he only dates magicians, so' It's part charm, part aesthetic, and all about that enchanting energy. With smooth transitions, sparkly edits, and a wink of playfulness, the trend blurs the line between everyday girls and spell-casting sirens. Whether you're into literal magic tricks or just the kind of girl who can turn heads with a vibe shift, this trend is your cue to pull some confidence out of your sleeve. Because sometimes? The real magic is being that girl.

name: Modern to Mythic Transition
trend_description: Step aside, everyday fits TikTok is entering its drama dynasty era. In the Modern to Mythic trend, creators begin in casual, modern-day outfits and then execute a dramatic transition into jaw-dropping warrior-inspired ensembles straight out of a Chinese costume drama. The cherry on top? The background track is none other than 'MAMA' by EXO, setting the stage with its cinematic energy and epic beat drops. As soon as the music shifts, so does the entire vibe fans, swords, flowing hanfu robes, and intricate hairpieces included. This trend is a love letter to historical fantasy, C-drama aesthetics, and the sheer power of a good transformation. Whether you're channeling a fierce general, ethereal cultivator, or legendary empress, the message is clear: Modern girl by day, wuxia legend by night.

name: Head Over Feels
trend_description: Welcome to the whirlwind of emotion that is 'Head Over Feels' the latest TikTok trend where creators tap into their most dizzying, love-struck (or chaotic) moments set to the iconic lyric: 'My head's spinning around, I can't see clear no more' from Love Me Like You Do by Ellie Goulding. Whether it's a clip of a relationship that's emotionally messy, a moment of total infatuation, or even a comedic spiral into confusion (cue: exam stress, outfit panic, or falling for a fictional character), users overlay this lyric as both soundtrack and caption, letting the vibe do all the talking. Dramatic, dreamy, or downright disoriented this trend is pure pop-culture poetry in motion.

name: Rare Layers & Scented Stories
trend_description: BeautyTok is lighting up over Rare Beauty's latest sensory launch: the Rare Eau de Parfum paired with its customizable Fragrance Layering Balms. This trend dubbed 'Scented Stories' is all about crafting a fragrance that's uniquely you using Rare Beauty's luxe yet accessible new products. Rare Eau de Parfum debuts on August7, 2025, as Rare Beauty's first fine fragrance. Composed by perfumer Jrme Epinette, the scent opens with rich top notes of creamy caramel, pink pepper, and pistachio, then blooms into a heart of vanilla, ginger, and cocoa beans, before settling into a warm base of sandalwood, skin musk, and tonka bean a gourmand, spicy, and cozy scent that evolves with every moment. To unlock full personalization, Rare introduces four Fragrance Layering Balms Amber Vanilla, Floral Peony Blossom, Fresh Bergamot, and Woody Oak each meant to be tapped on before or mixed with the perfume to customize the overall aroma, from bright and breezy to earthy and sensual.

name: Glamlite x Daus Mendoza Collaboration
trend_description: BeautyTok is lighting up with the bold and playful energy of the Glamlite x Daus Mendoza collaboration. From eye-catching packaging to a color story that screams fearless glam, creators are swatching, slaying, and serving face using this collection. The collab is packed with creamy formulas, stunning pigment payoff, and a vibe that feels like a full beat and a fiesta in one. It's not just a makeup drop it's a statement/.

name: Nyx Cosmetics x Wednesday Collaboration
trend_description: BeautyTok has officially entered its dark era with the chillingly chic Wednesday x NYX Cosmetics collaboration. Inspired by Netflix's hit series Wednesday, this limited-edition line has creators trading in soft glows for gothic glam, resurrecting a love for moody tones, sharp liners, and statement pigment. From the ""Nevermore Academy"" eyeshadow palette packed with smoky purples, eerie metallics, and charcoals, to the black-rose lipsticks that scream Addams-core elegance, this collection is a love letter to the strange and the stunning.

name: July Reading Wrap Up
trend_description: As the calendar flips to August, BookTok is closing the chapter on another month of page-turners with the July Reading Wrap-Up trend. Readers are recapping the emotional rollercoasters, surprise five-star reads, and DNF heartbreaks that defined their month often in cozy montages or speedy 'rate & react' style edits. Whether it was romance that wrecked them, thrillers that had them spiraling, or fantasies that stole their soul, this trend is where stories get their final rating and hot takes fly.

name: Oreo x Reese's Peanut Butter
trend_description: SnackTok is losing it over the latest sweet tooth supercollab: OREO x Reese's Peanut Butter. In the Double the Crave, Double the Chaos trend, creators are taste-testing, unboxing, and ranking the new mashup that blends the iconic crunch of Oreo cookies with the creamy, salty-sweet decadence of Reese's peanut butter creme. Whether it's a first-bite reaction or full-on dessert hacks using the new flavor, this trend is a full-blown flavor fest and everyone's racing to get their hands on a pack before it vanishes off shelves.

name: Poncho Revival
trend_description: Flowy, effortless, and fashionably unpredictable poncho tops are officially having their moment again. In the Poncho Revival trend, creators are styling these draped silhouettes in everything from coastal cowgirl aesthetics to city boho chic. Think airy fabrics, bold prints, fringe edges, and the perfect layering piece that turns a simple outfit into a statement. Whether it's tossed over a bikini at the beach or layered with denim and boots for that transitional fall flair, ponchos are making their comeback louder and breezier than ever.

name: Yes, No, or Maybe Booktok Version
trend_description: BookTok is cutting through the TBR chaos with a no-fluff review trend that's as fast as it is brutally honest. In the Yes, No, Maybe So Reads trend, creators list the books they've read and drop instant verdicts: a confident yes for must-reads, a savage no for disappointments, and a cautious maybe for those that fall in the middle. It's the literary version of speed dating quick takes, bold opinions, and zero sugar-coating. If you need help trimming your booklist (or growing it even more), this trend has your next pick or pass.

name: Coca-Cola Starlight Meal
trend_description: Fast food meets futuristic flavor in the viral Coca-Cola Starlight Meal at Jack in the Box. Riding the wave of space-inspired sips, this limited-time combo has TikTok foodies rushing to taste the galactic vibes. The star of the show? Coca-Cola Starlight a subtly sweet, slightly spiced soda with hints of cotton candy and roasted marshmallow. Paired with Jack's savory fan-faves, this out-of-this-world meal has creators filming celestial taste tests and aesthetic hauls under neon lights. It's giving cosmic cravings and constellation-core.

name: Dulce de Leche Cinabbon Delights
trend_description: Taco Bell is turning up the heat on sweet with their latest dessert drop: the Dulce de Leche Cinnabon Delights. This trend is all over foodtok as creators take that first gooey bite and capture the golden caramel filling oozing out of the cinnamon-sugar shell. It's the familiar Cinnabon Delight you love, now with a rich, velvety dulce de leche twist that's got dessert lovers in a sugar-fueled spiral. Whether it's a late-night drive-thru treat or the star of your snack haul, these little bites of caramel gold are the newest obsession.

name: Dunkin Blueberry Refresher
trend_description: Dunkin's new Blueberry Refresher has officially taken over the fast food scene and FoodTok is sipping it up. A vibrant, icy blend of blueberry flavor and green tea or lemonade base, this refreshment is giving cool, fruity, and perfectly photogenic. Creators are filming their first sips, matching the drink to their outfits, and even ranking it against other Dunkin drinks in sun-drenched car videos. Whether you're team lemonade or tea, one thing's clear: this berry blast is summer in a cup.

name: NFL Season Kickoff
trend_description: The NFL season is officially underway, and SportsTok is lighting up like stadium lights on a Sunday night. From jersey reveals and fantasy draft reactions to tailgate spreads and touchdown dances, creators are celebrating the return of football with full fanfare. POVs of fans claiming 'this is our year,' game-day outfit checks, and emotional throwbacks to last season's highlights are flooding the feed. Whether you're a die-hard loyalist or just here for the halftime snacks, the start of NFL 2025 is uniting the internet in pure gridiron hype.

name: I'll be there
trend_description: This emotional pop culture trend is soundtracked by a viral audio repeating the heartfelt phrase 'I'll be there' and creators are using it to highlight their most loyal constants. Whether it's their day-one besties, their childhood stuffed animal making cameos in every vacation pic, or even that one item they never leave home without (hello, emotional support water bottle), this trend is all about celebrating the people, pets, and possessions that have always shown up, no matter what. It's a digital scrapbook of love, loyalty, and lowkey nostalgia.This emotional pop culture trend is soundtracked by a viral audio repeating the heartfelt phrase 'I'll be there' and creators are using it to highlight their most loyal constants. Whether it's their day-one besties, their childhood stuffed animal making cameos in every vacation pic, or even that one item they never leave home without (hello, emotional support water bottle), this trend is all about celebrating the people, pets, and possessions that have always shown up, no matter what. It's a digital scrapbook of love, loyalty, and lowkey nostalgia.

name: Tula Spresso Eye Balms
trend_description: The beauty crowd is buzzing literally thanks to the newly dropped TULA Spresso Eye Balms, and TikTok can't get enough. These caffeine-infused cooling balms are being hailed as an instant wake-up call for your under eyes, with creators swiping them on mid-get-ready or mid-coffee-run. Available in energizing shades like Coffee Bean and Vanilla Latte, they promise de-puffing, brightening, and that just-had-an-iced-latte glow. It's the perfect combo of skincare and self-care no barista required.

name: Kopari Ceramide Cleansing Balm
trend_description: The Kopari Ceramide Cleansing Balm has just landed, and beauty creators are treating it like a spa day in a jar. This coconut-powered balm melts away makeup, sunscreen, and stress in one swipe while nourishing the skin barrier with five types of ceramides. As creators scoop, swirl, and glide the balm across their faces, TikTok is obsessed with the smooth-emulsifying texture and skin-loving finish. Think of it as a deep cleanse meets deep hydration moment, wrapped in Kopari's signature clean-girl aesthetic.

name: Sheet Pan Quesadilla
trend_description: FoodTok is folding up the fuss and serving major flavor with the viral sheet pan quesadilla trend. Creators are layering tortillas, cheese, meats, veggies, and more across one giant pan, folding it into a massive, golden-brown quesadilla that feeds a crowd. It's quick, crunchy, cheesy and endlessly customizable. Whether it's buffalo chicken, breakfast-style, or classic beef and beans, this hack is giving family dinners, party snacks, and lazy Sundays a delicious upgrade with zero stovetop mess.

name: You Belong Here
trend_description: BookTok is buzzing with suspense as You Belong Here by Megan Miranda takes center stage. In this chilling small-town mystery, a journalist returns to her childhood home only to unravel secrets tied to a decades-old tragedy involving her own family. Readers are sharing emotional reactions, jaw-dropping plot twists, and aesthetic dark-academia-style edits as they dive into the eerie atmosphere Miranda is known for. If you love slow-burn suspense, unreliable memories, and a town that keeps its skeletons buried deep this book just might be your next obsession.

name: Target Suede Bag
trend_description: FashionTok is buzzing over Target's viral suede dupe bag that's serving quiet luxury without the luxury price tag. With its soft faux-suede finish, slouchy silhouette, and chic neutral tones, this under-$40 find is being hailed as the 'It Girl everyday bag' of the season. Creators are styling it with fall-ready outfits from denim and knits to trench coats and boots calling it the ultimate transitional piece that looks designer but keeps things budget-friendly. It's giving effortless, elevated, and unexpectedly Target.

name: Wendy's Meal of Misfortune
trend_description: Fast food gets a deliciously dark twist as Wendy's teams up with Wednesday (yes, that Wednesday) for the all-new Wednesday's Meal of Misfortune and FoodTok is eating it up, literally. With an aesthetic pulled straight from Nevermore Academy, the collab features a spooky-luxe limited-edition meal that blends eerie vibes with serious flavor. Think dark garlic buns, hauntingly spiced fries, and a 'mystery' dipping sauce that creators are trying to decode. TikTokers are unboxing the meal with Wednesdaycore transitions, moody lighting, and reactions worthy of a Tim Burton cutscene. It's creepy, it's kooky, and honestly? It slaps.

name: Crumbl Dirty Sodas
trend_description: Crumbl is stirring up more than just cookies enter the Dirty Sodas, their latest sweet twist shaking up Quick Serve content on TikTok. These fizzy concoctions blend soda bases like Dr. Pepper or Sprite with creamy layers, fruity syrups, and unexpected mix-ins (think coconut, lime, and even cookie-infused flavor shots). Creators are pulling up to Crumbl for taste tests, aesthetic sips, and 'which Dirty Soda are you?' POVs. Whether you're team tangy or creamy-dreamy, FoodTok is officially sipping dirty this season.

name: Dutch 2O Takeover
trend_description: Dutch Bros just went viral again this time for its Dutch 2O drinks, a line of fruit-infused sparkling waters that's blowing up on Quick Serve FoodTok. These bubbly, lightly sweetened refreshers offer a guilt-free twist to your usual coffee run, and creators are obsessing over combos like 'Mango + Strawberry + Coconut' or 'Peach + Watermelon + Lime.' With bright colors, clear cups, and fizzy ASMR potential, TikTokers are rating flavors, revealing their go-to mixes, and showing off the main character hydration energy. It's not just water it's a whole aesthetic.

name: Son Heung-min leaving Tottenham Hotspur
trend_description: A wave of emotion is sweeping through SportsTok as fans react to the shocking news: Son Heung-min is set to leave Tottenham Hotspur. After years of loyalty, leadership, and legendary goals, the beloved South Korean forward is reportedly moving on and TikTok is buzzing with tributes, theories, and heartfelt goodbyes. From emotional compilations of his best Spurs moments to speculation about his next club, creators are using trending audios and dramatic edits to process the end of an era. Whether you're heartbroken, hopeful, or just here for the drama, this trend is where football fandom gets personal.

name: Jump then Drop
trend_description: This trend is all about the ultimate fake-out. It kicks off with creators pretending to play a quirky jumping game knees bent, focused faces, getting ready to leap over someone crouched on the ground. But just when you think you're watching a playground challenge, the beat drops and the video snaps into a full-on dance moment with flashing lights, fierce moves, and chaotic energy. The contrast between childhood play and party-mode makes Jump Then Drop a hilarious, high-energy trend that's lighting up feeds with unexpected transitions and serious rhythm.

name: Pull the Lever, Kronk!
trend_description: In this cinematic transition trend, creators kick things off mid-flight, seated in an airplane, mouthing the iconic line 'Pull the lever, Kronk!' from The Emperor's New Groove. Just as the phrase ends, the screen dramatically cuts to them "falling" cue clever camera drops or drone shots before landing in a stunning travel destination: crystal-clear waters, white sand beaches, or vibrant cityscapes. The contrast between cramped cabins and breathtaking views makes this trend a humorous yet dreamy flex of travel goals and editing skills, with a sprinkle of pop culture nostalgia.

name: 'Sorry If I Say I Need You' Syndrome
trend_description: In this theatrical TikTok trend, one friend takes center stage lip syncing 'I'm sorry if I say I need you' from One Direction's Strong with Oscar-worthy drama while their entire friend group tries to hold them back like it's an exorcism of pure directioner emotion. Whether they're dramatically clutching their chest, reaching to the heavens, or sinking to the floor, it's all about the uncontrollable need to feel every single lyric. The result? Comedy, chaos, and a whole lot of shared nostalgia.

name: Lambada x On the Floor
trend_description: This dance trend is heating up TikTok as creators groove to the Lambada x On the Floor remix. With its infectious rhythm and throwback-meets-modern beat, the audio has become the go-to track for creators showing off their best moves and syncing up with the vibe.

name: Nonchalant Proposal
trend_description: In a plot twist straight out of a deadpan rom-com, couples on TikTok are redefining proposal goals with the 'Low-Key I Do' trend. No flash mobs, no fireworks just fries, soft drinks, and a ring casually slid across the table mid-bite. The best part? The girls' reactions (or lack thereof). Instead of tears or gasps, they nonchalantly open the box, slip on the ring, and go right back to eating like it's just another Tuesday. It's dry humor, soft love, and chaotic simplicity rolled into one because who needs drama when you've got forever and a side of nuggets?

name: She's Iconic, He's Poetic
trend_description: In this hilarious and adorable trend, girlfriends hand the mic (and the lyric) to their boyfriends and let them freestyle the next line to 'That's my baby, she's iconic' The catch? The next words are completely made up often turning sweet, savage, or downright chaotic. From 'when she's hungry, she's demonic' to 'in the mall, she's bionic,' this trend is the ultimate blend of love and lyrical improv.

name: Back to the Future or Balling
trend_description: In this playful pick-your-type trend, creators put two different "types" or preferences on either side of the screen like 'bookworm' vs. 'gym rat,' or 'skater boy' vs. 'corporate king.' As the TikTok audio hits 'back to the future,' they point to one side, then flip to the other as 'balling' drops, showing which one really wins their heart (or vibe). It's the ultimate showdown of taste, one lyric at a time.

name: Fenty Beauty Smurf Collection
trend_description: Fenty Beauty just turned the internet blue in the best way possible. The Smurf Collection is making waves on BeautyTok as creators unbox, swatch, and transform their looks using the vibrant, limited-edition line inspired by the iconic blue crew. From bold lip shades to playful packaging, this drop is all about fun, color, and unapologetic nostalgia. Expect smudges of sapphire, shimmering highlights, and a whole lot of Smurfcore energy in your feed.

name: Fenty Beauty Diamond Bomb Collection
trend_description: The glow is getting louder on BeautyTok as the newly released Fenty Beauty Diamond Bomb Collection steals the spotlight. This trend is all about that ultra-reflective, icy shimmer that gives skin a next-level sparkle. Creators are dusting their cheeks, collarbones, and even eyelids with the multidimensional glow, showing how this collection turns any look into a full-on light show. Whether it's for golden hour selfies or all-out glam, this drop is redefining what it means to shine bright like a diamond.

name: The Fallen and the Kiss of Dusk
trend_description: BookTok is falling under the spell of "The Fallen and the Kiss of Dusk", the latest obsession lighting up dark fantasy corners of the internet. This trend is all about swooning over forbidden love, ancient curses, and enemies who'd rather kiss than kill. Readers are posting dreamy edits, emotional reactions, and aesthetic montages that capture the hauntingly romantic atmosphere of duskfall kingdoms, tragic fates, and magnetic anti-heroes. If you're a fan of morally gray leads and slow-burning tension that unravels like prophecy, this one's your next descent into literary heartbreak.

name: Well, Actually
trend_description: BookTok is falling hard for Well, Actually by Mazey Eddings a whip-smart rom-com that's equal parts emotionally tender and laugh-out-loud funny. This trend highlights creators sharing their reactions to the story of a neurodivergent writer navigating internet fame, messy exes, and rediscovering love with the help of an unexpected ally. With themes of mental health, identity, and the pressure of being chronically online, readers are posting everything from annotated pages to tearful wrap-ups, showing how Eddings once again nailed the perfect blend of depth and swoon.

name: Last, Now, Next
trend_description: BookTok is turning into a virtual bookshelf as creators hop on the Last, Now, Next trend a sleek and satisfying way to share their latest reading updates. With just three book covers and quick commentary, users showcase what they just finished (last), what they're currently devouring (now), and what's queued up (next). Whether it's a whirlwind romance, dark fantasy, or spicy thriller, this trend lets followers peek into TBRs in real time and maybe even steal a rec or two.

name: Pepsi Probiotic Drinks
trend_description: FoodTok is stirring with speculation as news breaks about Pepsi's unexpected foray into the wellness world probiotic drinks. While there aren't many taste-test videos just yet, creators are already chatting about what this means for the future of fizzy drinks. Will it be the next big thing in functional beverages, or just a short-lived experiment? For now, the conversation is bubbling and all eyes (and stomachs) are waiting.

name: The Summer Drink
trend_description: DrinkTok has discovered its chaotic cool-down of the season: the viral summer drink a bold mix of Red Bull Watermelon, Cucumber Gatorade, and a Tajn rim for that spicy twist. It's the kind of combo that sounds illegal but tastes like peak summer energy in a cup. From chaotic first sips to glowing reviews, creators are blending this unlikely trio and calling it the ultimate hydration-meets-hype moment.

name: National Root Beer Float Day
trend_description: DrinkTok is getting frothy with excitement for National Root Beer Float Day a nostalgic celebration bubbling back to the spotlight. From classic scoops of vanilla in icy root beer to creative twists featuring unexpected flavors and toppings, creators are already counting down the days with fizzy previews, DIY tutorials, and float-styled aesthetics. It's more than just a drink it's a throwback in a glass.

name: Sunnies like Hailey
trend_description: FashionTok is throwing major shade in the best way with the Hailey Bieber Sunglasses trend. After the model was spotted sporting the ultra-chic Miu Miu wraparound shades, creators are on a mission to find the perfect dupe. From affordable finds to identical lookalikes, feeds are now flooded with slick, futuristic frames and side-by-side reveals that prove you don't need Bieber's budget to serve her style.

name: Ruffle Skirts
trend_description: FashionTok is floating into flirty territory with the rising obsession over ruffle skirts. From tiered minis to asymmetrical maxis, these skirts are adding movement, drama, and a soft romantic flair to every outfit. Whether paired with vintage tees, ballet flats, or oversized knits, creators are loving how ruffles instantly elevate even the simplest looks twirl optional, but highly encouraged.

name: Baggy Jeans tucked into Boots
trend_description: A bold revival is sweeping FashionTok as creators bring back the unexpected combo of baggy jeans tucked into boots. Whether it's denim stuffed into knee-highs, combat boots, or sleek pointed toes, this trend gives off effortless edge with just the right touch of chaos. It's a style statement that feels both street and runway a nod to Y2K rebellion with a 2025 twist.

name: Chipotle Adobo Ranch
trend_description: Quick-serve foodies are raving over Chipotle's newest flavor twist the Adobo Ranch. This creamy, smoky-spicy sauce is stirring up conversations and content as fans drizzle it over burrito bowls, dip their chips, or smother it on tacos. The flavor mash-up of bold adobo and cool ranch is earning its spot as the next must-try Chipotle hack.

name: Boba Burstin Slushies
trend_description: Dave's Hot Chicken just turned up the cool factor with their new Boba Burstin' Slushies icy, refreshing drinks packed with juicy boba pearls that burst with flavor. TikTokers are flocking to try the unexpected combo of spicy tenders and sweet, slushy goodness, filming first sips and flavor reactions. It's a bold, summer-perfect mix that's heating up and cooling down feeds all at once.

name: Wingstop Hot Lemon Pepper
trend_description: Wingstop just dropped its Hot Lemon Pepper flavor and TikTok's taste buds are buzzing. A fiery twist on the fan-favorite lemon pepper, this new flavor brings the heat while keeping that tangy, citrusy kick. Creators are diving into their saucy orders, rating spice levels, and claiming it's the ultimate flavor glow-up. It's bold, it's messy, and it's officially the wing of the moment.

name: FIBA Asia Cup 2025
trend_description: SportsTok is turning up the heat as the FIBA Asia Cup 2025 quickly approaches, bringing 16 elite teams from Asia and Oceania to Jeddah, Saudi Arabia, for the continent's most prestigious basketball showdown from August 5-17. This trend captures fan excitement around roster reveals, bracket predictions, and who might upset the Boomers' title streak. Groups are stacked: Australia is drawn with Lebanon, Qatar, and Korea in Group A, while Pool C features high-stakes matchups among Jordan, India, China, and Saudi Arabia.

name: Novak Djokovic withdraws from the Cincinnati Open
trend_description: SportsTok is buzzing as Novak Djokovic withdraws from the Cincinnati Open, sparking heated conversation and content ahead of the US Open. Instead of competing in the Cincinnati Masters, Djokovic now 38 and racing the clock of age and injuries has opted to rest and mentally prep for Flushing Meadows, bypassing his last hard-court tune-up before the major kicks off on August 24

name: Summer Series Crown: Red Devils Rising
trend_description: SportsTok is buzzing as Manchester United secured the title at the 2025 Premier League Summer Series in the United States. The final showdown an electrifying 2' 2 draw against Everton at Atlanta's Mercedes' Benz Stadium sealed the victory. Despite conceding twice, United finished unbeaten, with early goals from Bruno Fernandes (penalty) and a sublime strike by Mason Mount, plus standout contributions from new signing Bryan Mbeumo for strong attacking chemistry.

name: Fall Aesthetic
trend_description: As the air turns crisp and pumpkin spice returns to the shelves, HomeTok is diving headfirst into fall aesthetic mode. This trend is all about transforming everyday spaces into autumn sanctuaries think rust-toned throw blankets, moody candlelight, woven textures, dried florals, and the soft scent of apple cider wafting in the background. From bookshelf restyling and velvet pillow swaps to entryways decked out with mini pumpkins and amber glass accents, creators are showing how even the smallest corners of a home can radiate cozy, nostalgic fall energy. It's not just decor it's an invitation to slow down and romanticize staying in. Whether you're Team Terracotta or obsessed with plaid, this trend is where warm color palettes, layered textures, and seasonal scents take over the feed in the most aesthetically satisfying way possible.

name: Fall Shopping Haul
trend_description: Home lifestyle creators are officially entering their autumn girl era with this cozy season kickoff trend: the Fall Shopping Haul. From oversized knit throws and cinnamon-scented candles to amber glassware, moody florals, and pumpkin everything feeds are filling up with aesthetic unboxings and Target runs turned rituals. The vibe? Intentional nesting meets 'I just needed one thing, but left with a cart full of fall.' Whether it's prepping for tablescapes or swapping out summer for spice-toned decor, this trend is all about elevating the everyday with textures, colors, and cozy details that scream fall.

name: Rustic Farmhouse
trend_description: The home lifestyle scene is getting a warm, lived-in refresh with the Rustic Farmhouse Design trend making its cozy comeback. Think distressed wood beams, vintage finds, shiplap walls, antique brass accents, and neutral tones layered with texture. Creators are opening their doors to a design style that feels timeless yet grounded, blending rural charm with modern comfort. Whether it's a reclaimed wood dining table, an open-shelved kitchen, or cozy nooks filled with ticking stripe cushions and woven baskets every corner whispers nostalgia with a refined touch. This trend is less about perfection, more about personality and patina, reminding viewers that comfort, charm, and character are always in style.

name: Ring, Ring, Ring
trend_description: Pop culture meets lowkey groove in the Ring Ring Energy trend, where creators vibe to Tyler, The Creator's 'Ring Ring Ring' with a chill, understated dance that's all about smooth attitude. The standout move? A casual thumb-and-pinky phone gesture that gives just the right amount of main character energy. It's not flashy it's intentional. The kind of dance that feels like you're in on something cool, without even trying.

name: Eating at every fastfood place we both agree on
trend_description: In the If We Both Say Yes trend, creators put their fast food loyalties to the test literally. Set to an audio listing various fast food chains, couples or besties close their eyes and only open them for the spots they both agree on. The challenge? Only dining at the places where their cravings align. From Chick-fil-A stans to Taco Bell ride-or-dies, this trend reveals where the real food love overlaps. It's part compatibility test, part hunger game and viewers are loving the unspoken drama of that one person who refuses to open their eyes for McDonald's.

name: Peak Anti-Jeremiah
trend_description: In the trend Not When He's On Screen, The Summer I Turned Pretty fans are letting the internet know exactly how they feel about Jeremiah and it's not subtle. From mock-throwing their TVs to dramatically storming out of the room, fans are using humor and chaos to express their full-blown anti-Jeremiah agenda. Whether you're Team Conrad or just passionately not Team Jeremiah, this trend is peak BookTok-meets-PopTok chaos, perfectly timed for the most emotionally charged episodes of the season.

name: rem Beauty Plumping Lip Gloss
